articles.title: 15th Kimjongilia Festival Opens
articles.content:
15th Kimjongilia Festival Opens
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The 15th Kimjongilia Festival opened here on Monday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, February 16.
					 Displayed were a lot of potted Kimjongilias in full bloom raised by many units including the armed forces and power organs, ministries and national institutions, soldiers, people from all walks of life and school youth and children. 
					
					 Entrants also include the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, overseas compatriots, diplomatic missions of different countries and missions of international organizations here, foreign organizations for friendship and solidarity, personages and Chinese residents. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, Kang Nung Su, officials concerned, and overseas compatriots' congratulatory groups including the group of Koreans in Japan. 
					
					 Minister of Culture An Tong Chun made an address. 
					
					 At the end of the opening ceremony the participants looked round the venue.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Venue of Kimjongilia Festival
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Venue of Kimjongilia Festival
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps and officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here visited the venue of the 15th Kimjongilia Festival on Monday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They were impressed to go round the venue of the festival pervaded with the best wishes of the Korean people and the world progressives for him.
					
					 At the end of their visit they made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Military Attaches Visit Venue of Kimjongilia Festival and Mansudae Studio
articles.content:
Military Attaches Visit Venue of Kimjongilia Festival and Mansudae Studio
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here Monday visited the venue of the 15th Kimjongilia Festival on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The members of the corps went round flowers praising the great man which came to full bloom with boundless reverence and sincerity of the Korean people and the world progressive.
					
					 At the end of their visit the guests made entries in the visitor's book.
					
					The corps also visited the Mansudae Art Studio on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulations from Syrian Defense Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations from Syrian Defense Minister
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift and a large floral basket from Ali Muhammad Habib Mahmoud, minister of Defence and deputy commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Syria, on the occasion of his birthday.
					 They were handed to the DPRK ambassador to Syria on Feb. 10.

articles.title: Congratulations from Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Congratulations from Foreign Diplomats
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received floral baskets and congratulatory letters from the diplomatic corps and the economic and commercial councilors corps here on the occasion of his birthday.
					 The baskets and letters were conveyed to DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and an official concerned by Russian Ambassador Valery Sukhinin, doyen of the diplomatic corps, and Wang Zhilin, economic and commercial councilor of the Chinese embassy and doyen of the economic and commercial councilors corps, on Monday.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Chinese Family
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Chinese Family
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, an anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr of China, Monday on the occasion of his birthday.

articles.title: Floral Baskets from Japanese
articles.content:
Floral Baskets from Japanese
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received baskets of flowers from Japanese personages on Monday on the occasion of his birthday.
					 They are Sumiko Shimizu, chairperson of the Japanese preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, Takashi Nada, chairman of the Ehime Prefectural committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, and Hinako Suemoto, representative of the Kyoto Women Council for the Promotion of Japan-Korea Friendship.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Family of Korean Resident in Russia
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Family of Korean Resident in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Monday received a floral basket from the family of Jong Il Sim, Korean resident in Russia, on the occasion of his birthday.

articles.title: "Our Classroom" Literature Prize Awarded to Schoolchildren
articles.content:
"Our Classroom" Literature Prize Awarded to Schoolchildren
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- "Our Classroom" literature prize was awarded to schoolchildren on the threshold of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 A ceremony of awarding the prize took place at the Hall of the Youth League on Monday. The prize was conferred on at least 400 schoolchildren from across the country including Kim Jin Guk of Kang Pan Sok Secondary School. 
					
					 The literary works created by them include selection of poems "Our General Is Best", composition "The Pilot Sector for a Thriving Nation", child poem "Wind of Songun Is Nice" and lyrics "Increasing Songun Scenery", which represented the Songun leadership feats of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Among them are also child poem "Wind of Huichon", juvenile song "Vinalon Cotton" and lyrics "Thriving Nation in Spring", which show the stirring reality of the DPRK in which great innovations and leap forward have been made at every worksite for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Besides, there are works telling about the life of schoolchildren who delighted Kim Jong Il by distinguishing themselves at study and organizational life.

articles.title: Preparations for International Figure Skating Festival Brisk
articles.content:
Preparations for International Figure Skating Festival Brisk
						
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 20th Paektusan Prize International Figure-skating Festival are making brisk headway in the DPRK.
					The festival is due to open in Pyongyang on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 All panels of the preparatory committee of the festival are creditably performing their functions and roles to make the festival successful.
					
					 Rehearsals of the programs to be staged by figure skaters and school youth and children at an opening ceremony of the festival are progressing at a final phase. 
					
					 Coaches, teachers and figure skaters of various sports teams and creators of the mass gymnastic display production unit are giving final touches to the peculiar numbers so that they may ensure a high level of representation.
					
					 Officials in the relevant field and employees of the Ice Rink are busy gorgeously decorating the venue of the festival.
					
					 Great efforts are being channeled into increasing the lighting effect and new costumes are ready for performers.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Dynamic Leadership Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Dynamic Leadership Lauded 
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The servicepersons and people of the DPRK are paying high tribute to the undying feats General Secretary Kim Jong Il has performed by leading the cause of building a thriving nation to victory on the occasion of his birthday, February 16.
					 With the historic Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea and the celebrations of the 65th anniversary of the WPK last year as important momentums he developed it into an invincible party which is materializing the idea of President Kim Il Sung and carrying out his cause, single-mindedly united around Kim Jong Il, always holding the President in high esteem.
					
					 He built a strong mainstay for the building of a thriving socialist nation by giving full play to the inexhaustible mental power of all the soldiers and people and brought about steady successes in the drives for putting the national economy on a Juche basis, fully demonstrating the nation's economic might.
					
					 He brought about a signal success in the development of the independent economy by making sure that the ultra-modern Juche iron production system was rounded off and successfully led the work for putting the production processes of the February 8 Vinalon Complex and the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex on a modern and scientific basis at a high level, enabling the whole country celebrate those great events.
					
					 Under his wise guidance the Huichon Ryonha General Machine Plant has turned into a model plant in the 21st century and a high-pitched drive for introducing CNC was under way not only in key industrial fields but in light industrial, agricultural and all other fields.
					
					 He tirelessly visited work sites for a great surge one after another, bringing about great innovations and leap forward in the efforts to lay a firm foundation for improving the people's standard of living.
					
					 The Korean people are firmly confident that a shining success is sure to be achieved in the drive to improve the people's standard of living and build a thriving nation as long as they are led by him.

articles.title: Palestinian Celebrates Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Palestinian Celebrates Kim Jong Il's Birthday
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The director of Ilal Amam, an organ of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, issued a statement on Feb. 8 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The statement said:
					
					 We warmly congratulate General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his birthday. 
					
					 His good health is the wish of not only the Korean people but also the Palestinian people and all other fighters for freedom in the world.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung is a close friend who helped in blood the Arabian people in the struggle for justice and rendered mental and material assistance to them.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is now perfectly carrying forward the cause of the President.
					
					 The DPRK has become the symbol of indomitable fighting spirit and stubbornness as it is led by him pursuing the Songun politics in face of the hostile forces' challenges.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Seminars, photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Nepal and Ethiopia between Feb. 3 and 7 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at their venues were photos on his feats.
					
					 Present there were personages of the Nepalese national preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16, the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal and the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea and its branch and the masses of those countries.
					
					 The seminars dealt with the feats of Kim Jong Il reliably defending the cause of socialism and wisely leading the Korean people in the drive for building a thriving nation with the might of Songun. 
					
					 The acting chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal and other speakers said that his birthday has become an auspicious holiday of not only the Korean people but also the world progressives struggling for independence for his great idea and wise leadership and precious feats.
					
					 The secretary general of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea said that the Juche idea is the idea that the Ethiopian youth and people should follow.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has made great contribution to peace and development of not only Korea but also the world, he added.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the seminars.
					
					 The Korean films shown included "Reply of Korea" and "Korea Shining with Long History".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreigners
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreigners
						
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Regional bodies and organizations of different countries carried articles in celebration of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted on its Internet homepage articles and photos on the feats of Kim Jong Il on Feb. 7 and 8.
					
					 The homepage in an article titled "Kim Jong Il on the road for happiness of the people" said that the Korean people have achieved many successes by their own efforts despite the blockade and sanctions of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces. This would have been unthinkable without the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, it added.
					
					 The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted on Internet an article, which stressed that Kim Jong Il is the sun shining in the 21st century with the same brightness and warmth as the sun of Kim Il Sung gave.
					
					 The U.S. Group for the Study of Songun Politics in an article posted on Internet said that the birth of Kim Jong Il was a great fortune of the Korean nation and the world as it provided a sure guarantee for the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche, the cause of Songun revolution started in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on Internet an article saying that Kim Jong Il's gaining of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army was a historic event that promised the bright future of the Korean nation to be reunified and prosperous.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Chinese Minister of Public Security
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Chinese Minister of Public Security
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Monday received Meng Jianzhu, state councilor of the People's Republic of China and minister of Public Security, and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there were Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 The Chinese minister of Public Security courteously conveyed to Kim Jong Il kind greetings of the senior party and state officials of China including Hu Jintao, general secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China.
					
					 Meng warmly congratulated Kim Jong Il on his birthday and wholeheartedly wished him good health, presenting the gifts prepared by himself to Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK.
					
					 Kim Jong Il thanked for this and asked Meng to convey his regards to the senior officials of the Chinese party and state including Hu Jintao. He had a cordial and friendly talk with Meng.
					
					 Meng warmly congratulated Kim Jong Il upon his reelection as general secretary of the WPK and Kim Jong Un upon his election as vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK at the historic Conference of the WPK, hailing the successful solution of the issue of succession to the Korean revolution.
					
					 Witnessing the reality of the DPRK, he was deeply impressed by the signal achievements made by the Korean people under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, he said, adding that the Chinese people are rejoiced over as over their own the achievements made by the fraternal Korean people.
					
					 Meng said he was very satisfied with the fact that leading officials in the fields of armed forces and security of China and the DPRK had an in-depth discussion of a series of important issues including the work to defend and glorify socialism and reached a full consensus of views.
					
					 Kim Jong Il highly appreciated the satisfactory success made by the Chinese Minister of Public Security in his visit to the DPRK and expressed expectation that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the fields of armed forces and security of the two parties and two countries would grow stronger day by day.
					
					 After receiving Meng and his party, Kim Jong Il gave a dinner for the guests.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Meng and his party, the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Present there were Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Ju Sang Song, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, member of the National Defence Commission and minister of People's Security, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and officials concerned.
					
					 The dinner proceeded in a cordial atmosphere overflowing with friendship.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Minister of Public Security
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Minister of Public Security
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Meng Jianzhu, minister of Public Security who is state councilor of the People's Republic of China, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
					 Meng said that the Sino-DPRK friendly relations sealed in blood are fraternal and comradely.
					
					 He underscored the need to strengthen and develop the Sino-DPRK relations provided by the leaders of the elder generations of the two countries generation after generation.
					
					 He noted that his visits to several places during his stay in the DPRK provided an opportunity to know well about the shining achievements made by the Korean people in the building of a thriving socialist nation by displaying the revolutionary fighting spirit and traits.
					
					 He expressed belief that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people would register greater success in the future, too.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Meets Chinese Minister of Public Security
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Meets Chinese Minister of Public Security
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Monday met and had a friendly talk with Meng Jianzhu, state councilor of the People's Republic of China and minister of Public Security, and his party.
					 Present there were Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, generals and other officers of the KPA and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Chinese Minister of Public Security Visits Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Chinese Minister of Public Security Visits Friendship Tower
						
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, state councilor of the People's Republic of China and minister of Public Security, laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower here on Monday.
					 Attending the wreath-laying ceremony were Vice-Minister Choe Jung Hwa and other officials of the DPRK Ministry of People's Security and the Chinese minister's party, Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Placed before the tower was the wreath in the name of Meng Jianzhu.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers, who fought in the Korean front against the armed invasion of the U.S. imperialists, and went round the tower.
					
					 Meng Jianzhu made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Serbian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Serbian President
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Feb. 7 sent a message of greetings to Boris Tadzic, President of Serbia, on its national day.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Serbia would develop, Kim in the message wished progress and prosperity to the Serbian people.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Serbian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Serbian PM
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greetings to Mirko Cvetkovic, Prime Minister of Serbia, on its national day on Feb. 7.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the peoples of the two countries would grow stronger day by day.
					
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Serbian counterpart Vuk Jeremic on the same day.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim met and had a talk with outgoing Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Le Van Cu at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Secretariat of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism led by Secretary General Masaharu Ueki visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill here on Monday.
					 It laid a floral basket before the statue and made deep bows in humble reverence for the President. 
					
					 The delegation arrived here that day.

articles.title: Heavy Snowfall Hits Central Part of Korea
articles.content:
Heavy Snowfall Hits Central Part of Korea
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- There was an unusual heavy snowfall in some parts of Kangwon Province of the DPRK.
					 According to data of meteorological observation, it snowed 350-450mm in Chonnae and Kosong Counties and Munchon City from 01:00 to 12:00 on Feb. 12 and 1 200mm in Kumgang County between 16:00 and 21:00 on Feb. 11.
					
					 Snowfall of 700mm was registered in Masikryong area in a few days. 
					
					 The recent heavy snowfall badly affected agricultural and other economic sectors in some areas of the province. 
					
					 A brisk drive for healing its aftermath is now under way in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Vol. 92 Off Press
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Vol. 92 Off Press
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 92 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works", a library of the Juche idea which systematically and comprehensively deals with his works in a chronological order. 
					 The book contains 52 works including speeches, conclusions and talks made by President Kim Il Sung from January to December, Juche 81 (1992).
					
					 "For Carrying Forward and Accomplishing the Socialist Cause" and other works comprehensively dealt with the noble will of the President to call upon the entire party and all the people to remain true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 His work "Enhancing the Role of the Popular Masses Is the Guarantee for Victory in the Cause of Independence" clarified the idea of dynamically promoting the socialist cause, the human cause of independence by steadily increasing the role of the popular masses, the driving force of history.
					
					 "Let Us Achieve the Country's Reunification Independently through the United Efforts of the Whole Nation" and other works clarified the WPK's fair and aboveboard and realistic proposals for reunification and practical ways for bringing about a turn in the movement for national reunification.
					
					 The book contains works which clarified issues of consolidating the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and extensively conducting the patriotic work among Koreans in Japan and those dealing with the strategic and tactical policies for boosting the international solidarity for the Korean revolution and accomplishing the cause of independence against imperialism.
					
					 It also contains works comprehensively dealing with ideas and theories making perfect clarifications of the issues arising in various fields including tasks for preserving national cultural heritages with care and further developing Taekwon-Do.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamps Issued
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamps Issued 
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued stamps to commemorate the 4th International Martial Arts Games and the INDIPEX 2011 World Philatelic Exhibition.
					 Depicted on stamps (one sheet and one sheetlets) on the games are the movement of Taekwon-Do, the orthodoxy martial art of the Korean nation, a portrait of Choe Hong Hui, ex-president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, and logo of the games.
					
					 Also represented are traditional martial arts of different countries including Pankration and Karate-Do.
					
					 A stamp (one sheet) on the exhibition to be held in India shows a logo of the exhibition and various means for mail delivery.

articles.title: Iron Production Bases Modernized
articles.content:
Iron Production Bases Modernized
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Iron production bases have been technologically updated in the DPRK in recent years based on Korean-style iron production method and the latest science and technology.
					 The Songjin Steel Complex rounded off the advanced steel production method in which oxygen melting and refining processes are streamlined.
					
					 The Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex succeeded in non-coke iron-making method at furnace and established the iron production system by high-speed reduction method. It also built new curved type strand-casting process.
					
					 The Chollima Steel Complex successfully built UHP electric arc furnaces Nos. 1 and 2, multielement alloy steel production base and high-quality fireproof material shop.
					
					 The Posan Iron Works is producing a great amount of Juche iron with a new method and sending them to the Chollima Steel Complex. It also completed a project for reconstructing revolving furnace No. 3 and set up oxygen separator of 550 cubic meters.
					
					 The Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex commissioned 100-ton electric furnace and put the power control and operation system and the electrode control system for UHP electric arc furnaces on a CNC basis. It is now introducing new rational technologies to round off Korean-style iron production process at a higher level. 
					
					 The DPRK has a bright prospect for increased iron production as its iron and steel production bases are being modernized relying on domestic deposits of iron ore and coal resources.

articles.title: Interferon Production Industrialized
articles.content:
Interferon Production Industrialized
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Medical Genetics Institute of Pyongyang College of Medicine of Kim Il Sung University has put the production of interferon on an industrial basis.
					 Interferon is indicated for prevention and treatment of viral diseases including C and B hepatitis and cancer.
					
					 The institute developed Korean-style gene expression technology and protein restructuring technology, establishing the up-to-date interferon production method. As a result, it far surpassed the advanced countries in the amount of interferon product and in its bio-activity.
					
					Particularly, it set up simple and cost-effective process of separating and refining interferon, boosting production 1,000 times. This made it possible to produce massive amount of antiviral medicament needed for one year in a short span of time.
					
					 The establishment of the small-scale but highly profitable interferon production process would greatly contribute to the development of the country's pharmaceutical industry and bio-engineering.

articles.title: Natural Wonders in Area of Jong Il Peak
articles.content:
Natural Wonders in Area of Jong Il Peak
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Peculiar natural phenomena heralding spring are observed in the area of Jong Il Peak of the DPRK.
					 Willow buds are out in Sobaeksu Valley as of Feb. 10 with the temperature in the area getting moderate from late January, according to data available at the Paektusan Secret Camp Meteorological Observatory.
					
					 Willow came into bud 9 days earlier than usual this year, said Ri Won Gil, 60, director of the observatory, who has lived in the area for more than 20 years. 
					
					 A solar halo appeared in the sky above Jong Il Peak for 32 minutes from 13:00 on Feb. 7 in wake of the similar phenomenon on Jan. 16, making the birthplace of leader Kim Jong Il in the Paektusan secret camp a spectacular sight.

articles.title: Former Unconverted Long-term Prisoner Becomes Doctor
articles.content:
Former Unconverted Long-term Prisoner Becomes Doctor 
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Su, former unconverted long-term prisoner, became a doctor at his advanced age of 80.
					 Born in Kyongju, North Kyongsang Province of south Korea, he longed for learning from his childhood.
					
					 He hoped for a teacher. His parents made every possible effort to provide him with an opportunity to learn. He also delivered newspapers but only went to night training school.
					
					 His hope remained a dream in the south Korean society where money decides everything. It was not until he came to the embrace of the DPRK after the war that his dream came true.
					
					 He graduated from Kim Il Sung University under the care of the country and became its teacher.
					
					 He took part in the struggle for the reunification of the country during which he was imprisoned in south Korea for decades. He defended his faith to the last in prison, looking far into the future when he would become a teacher of a reunified country. He finally came back to the fold of the socialist country.
					
					 He suffered from heart disease but recovered his health under the care of the state.
					
					 He authored several textbooks and books including "Chinese Study through Conversation" and "English Everyday Life Conversation" conducive to the education of the rising generation.
					
					 He presented "World Origins and Commonsense Dictionary" to the State Book Exhibition for celebrating the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea last year. He was awarded the DPRK doctorate in science of history shortly ago.

articles.title: Ideological and Cultural Heritage of DPRK
articles.content:
Ideological and Cultural Heritage of DPRK
						
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood" which was created in 1971 serves as a precious ideological and cultural heritage of the DPRK.
					 It was adapted from drama "The Sea of Blood", an immortal classic masterpiece, which was created by President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 It depicts a widow who embarked upon the road of revolution, following in the footsteps of her husband who was killed during the punitive operation of the Japanese imperialists, and her sons and daughter. 
					
					Under the energetic guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood" brought about a dramatic change in all aspects ranging from its contents and style to creating system and methods by doing away with the outdated patterns left for a long period in the field of opera at that time.
					
					 The opera is revolutionary and socialist in contents and popular and national in style.
					
					 All songs of the opera are made stanzaic and pangchang is introduced to it to make an objective depiction of the reality and situation in the given times, the inner world and behaviors of the characters.
					
					 The opera involves dances as essential means of representation and gives a three-dimensional depiction of the living environment by means of a new style stage decor, a combination of lighting, stage-setting, etc.
					
					 "The Flower Girl," "Tell O Forest" and other revolutionary operas were created one after another on the basis of "The Sea of Blood."

articles.title: Famous Winery
articles.content:
Famous Winery 
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Kanggye Wine Factory is the nation's leading wine producer.
					 Built in April 1956, it produces ferment liquors such as wine and Inphung wine, beer and raw rice wine with grapes and so on in Jagang Province as raw materials.
					
					 It updated the shop for treating raw materials before feeding, the  fermentation shop, packing shop and various other shops, underground storehouse and a laboratory. It has a vineyard.
					
					 The development of the small factory in a mountainous city is associated with the warm loving care of the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung made sure that a wine factory was built in the province and visited it several times, giving instructions to streamline the production and improve the quality of products.
					
					Whenever General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the factory, he clearly indicated the orientation and ways for keeping production going at a high rate. He showed deep care for the factory so that it might make a positive contribution to improving the people's standard of living.
					
					 The products turned out by this modern factory are popular on domestic and foreign markets.

articles.title: Sliced Vegetables Preserved in Soy Sauce, Traditional Food
articles.content:
Sliced Vegetables Preserved in Soy Sauce, Traditional Food
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Sliced vegetables preserved in soy sauce, traditional Korean food, are everyday dishes for the Koreans.
					 They are made of agricultural produce and meat.
					
					 Dried or pickled vegetables and edible grass are preserved in soy sauce or put into soybean paste and peppered bean paste. They are served with spices after being salted.
					
					 Meat is processed after being boiled down with soy sauce.
					
					 Nutritious pickles are good for health when taken regularly.
					
					 The Sariwon Jongbang Foodstuff Producers' Cooperative and other foodstuff producers across the country are preserving sliced cucumbers, radishes, broad bellflowers, mushrooms, etc. in soy sauce and supplying them to working people.
					
					 Catering centers are often organizing competitive shows and diversifying the kinds.

articles.title: US-Japan-S. Korea Triangular Military Alliance Slashed
articles.content:
US-Japan-S. Korea Triangular Military Alliance Slashed
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The need to foil a scheme to knock into shape the criminal U.S.-Japan-south Korea triangular military alliance is urged by a bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Monday. It is also essential for ensuring peace and security of Asia and the rest of the world and building a new independent and prosperous Asia, the article added. 
					 Citing evermore undisguised moves of the U.S., Japan and south Korea to establish the dangerous triangular military alliance for aggression, the article went on:
					
					 It is a task common to the people of Asia and the rest of the world to frustrate the U.S. moves to build up the alliance. 
					
					 This alliance is fraught with the danger of invasion and a war.
					
					 Its first target of attack is the Korean Peninsula, a top-priority task in carrying out an immediate task of the U.S. war strategy. 
					
					 The situation on the peninsula is rendered so grave due to the enemies' frantic moves for invasion that a war may break out there any moment.  A war in Korea is bound to spread to Asia and the rest of the world or may even turn into a nuclear war. This will naturally plunge Asia and the rest of the world into a disastrous war and a nuclear holocaust again.
					
					 The U.S. seeks to put the Asian region under its domination and control by putting the triangular military alliance into force. Japan attempts to take the advantage of the U.S. Asia strategy for aggression and become a leader of Asia. The enemies' criminal ambition to set up the alliance is becoming a grave threat to the sovereignty, peace and security of Asian countries. 
					
					 It is a sacred cause of protecting sovereignty, peace and security of Asian countries and an urgent requirement of the times at present to smash the moves to build up the triangular military alliance.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Drop Confrontation Policy
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Drop Confrontation Policy
						
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' policy for confrontation with the DPRK is the main cause of blocking the north-south dialogue and fostering the distrust and tensions between Koreans, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					 It is attributable to south Korea's policy for confrontation with the DPRK that no progress was made in the recent preliminary talks for opening the north-south high-level military talks, says the article.
					
					 It says that south Korea kicked up frantic confrontational racket against the DPRK when the talks to discuss the important issue of the nation were just a few days off.
					
					 Earlier stop to the confrontational policy in south Korea is essential for the improved north-south relations, desire of all the fellow countrymen and wish of the times, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should abandon the confrontational stand and take the stand of reconciliation, unity and reunification if they want to see the north-south ties warmed up.
					
					 It is impossible to repair the north-south relations if they persist in the war racket against the fellow countrymen in the DPRK, escalating the tensions, cutting the visits and contacts between the pro-reunification champions and pursuing the confrontation. 
					
					 Confrontation with fellow countrymen is a mode of existence of the traitors to the nation.
					
					 No one has the right to act contrary to the improvement of the north-south relations, a pressing issue of the times.
					
					 The desire of the fellow countrymen and the wish of the times can never be a plaything of the traitors.

articles.title: Scheme for Conclusion of FTA Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Scheme for Conclusion of FTA Protested in S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a commentary on Feb. 10 criticizing the authorities for their humiliating move for conclusion of "Free Trade Agreement".
					 That day the U.S. and the south Korean authorities finally signed the three agreements on the results of the additional negotiations for the conclusion of FTA on which they reached an agreement in December last year, the commentary said, adding: This is a humiliating action unprecedented in history and a declaration of war against the people.
					
					 It is an illegal act that the authorities inked the agreements without ratification of the "National Assembly" on the results of the additional negotiations, it charged.
					
					 The agreements, consistent with unilateral concession and humiliation to the U.S., should be abrogated at once, the commentary held.
					
					 It demanded that the authorities promptly stop the attempt to sell off the south Korean economy to the U.S., lock, stock and barrel, in disregard of the people's view.

articles.title: New US Military Strategy Aimed at Power Supremacy
articles.content:
New US Military Strategy Aimed at Power Supremacy
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Mike Mullen, chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff, on February 8 unveiled the 2011 National Military Strategy.
					 It, the first revision since 2004, is based on the 2010 National Security Strategy and the objectives in the latest Quadrennial Defense Review.
					
					 "Our military power is most effective when employed in support and in concert with other elements of power as part of whole-of-nation approaches to foreign policy," he wrote in the strategy.
					
					 Under the revision, the United States can stand alone of needed, but the strategy sees the future in coalitions.
					
					 The renewed strategy mirrors the U.S. ambition for power supremacy.

articles.title: Russia Exclaims against Japan's Territorial Claim
articles.content:
Russia Exclaims against Japan's Territorial Claim
 Moscow, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of Russia recently released a statement in protest against Japan's statement on the Southern Kuril Islands.
					 Moscow paid attention to the fact that Japan's traditional commemoration of the "Day of Northern Territories" took place this year in a more provocative, anti-Russian atmosphere, said the statement, adding:
					
					 The "Movement for Return of Northern Territories" backed by the Japanese government convened a "national gathering" at an international conference hall in Tokyo. Ringing out from the gathering were unforgivable and unreasonable voices claiming the dominium over the Southern Kurils, a legitimate part of the Russian territory.
					
					 The Foreign Ministry of Russia expresses resentment against what high-ranking officials said at the gathering. Unpardonable in view of diplomatic practice are their remarks concerning visits to the Southern Kurils paid by the Russian President and other officials some time ago.
					
					 Their hostile rhetoric is an outcome of Japan's policy. In particular, the fund the Japanese government provides to the "Movement for Return of Northern Territories" has steadily increased. Intentionally inciting the public to anti-Russian sentiments is obviously against statements of Tokyo which underline the need to develop cooperation and partnership with Moscow.
					
					 Russia lodges a strong protest against the Japanese authorities' inexcusable position. At the same time, Russia makes it clear that it can never accept Tokyo's territorial claim and denounces the provocative moves. 
					
					 The Japanese government is obliged to take all necessary measures to prevent the recurrence of such anti-Russian acts.

articles.title: Rhetoric Escalated between Russia, Japan
articles.content:
Rhetoric Escalated between Russia, Japan
 Moscow, February 14 (KCNA) -- The situation has been aggravated after Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan called Russian President Dmitri Medvedev's visit to the southern Kurils an "unforgivable outrage", said a Russian newspaper on Feb. 9. 
					 In an article titled "Escalating War of Words between Moscow and Tokyo over Southern Kurils", Kommersant said protests took place around Japanese diplomatic missions in Vladivostok and Moscow on Feb. 8 under the sponsorship of the "Youth Guards of the United Russia".
					
					 In the previous day, the Kremlin, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and members of the State Duma stated that Russia's dominium over the southern Kurils can not be a subject of reexamination, said the newspaper, adding:
					
					 Japanese Foreign Minister Seiji Maehara, afraid that his Russia visit would be spoiled, could not but say that Kan's remark was just his private opinion.
					
					 Young people in Vladivostok exhibited photos of the islands in the opposite side of the Japanese consulate general, along with a placard reading, "Kurils are Russia's territory".

articles.title: South Sudanese Emigrants Return Home for State Reconstruction
articles.content:
South Sudanese Emigrants Return Home for State Reconstruction
						
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- After achieving independence, south Sudan has turned out in the effort for eradicating the aftermaths of the longtime civil war.
					 South Sudanese emigrants have returned home to joint the effort.
					
					 A doctor said the population of south Sudan is 8 million but it has only less than 3 hundred doctors and 20 experienced maternity nurses. "That's why I returned," he said.
					
					 A businessman who had studied in Egypt and Europe and worked in Germany as an economic expert also came back to south Sudan to launch an effort for developing civic organizations.
					
					 He said if south Sudanese experts returned from abroad, they could make a great contribution to the reconstruction of the state.
					
					 South Sudanese people living in other countries have technologies and fund  badly needed by the country. Therefore, they can play a big role in bringing a change to its people.

articles.title: Chinese People's Daily on Misinformation through Internet
articles.content:
Chinese People's Daily on Misinformation through Internet
 Beijing, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Daily described misinformation spread through Internet as "evil virus".
					 In a commentary on January 30, the newspaper said such misinformation is aimed to disturb public sentiments under the disguise of the "people's opinion".
					
					 The "virus" badly affects the psychology of Internet users, impeding the sound development of Internet, the commentary said.
					
					 In recent years China has applied strict regulations to managing and using Internet, while prohibiting websites inciting people to national division or cults and spreading erotic and violence information.
					
					 Through a campaign to filter vulgar websites, it closed about 2,500 x-rate websites in the period from June to October last year.
					
					 It is viewed as a just measure for the interest of the people and the stability and harmonious development of the society.

articles.title: Communist Party Inaugurated in Serbia
articles.content:
Communist Party Inaugurated in Serbia
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A communist party was registered in Serbia to succeed the League of Communists of Yugoslavia (LCY) headed by Josip Breoz Tito.
					 Tito's grandson leads the new party the platform of which is to defend rights of all the Serbian citizens, revive the middle classes and renew the state.
					
					 The Communist Party called on Serbian people to join it and requested those with the LCY membership cards to change them with new cards.

articles.title: Food Shortage Becomes Serious in World
articles.content:
Food Shortage Becomes Serious in World
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Grain price has gone up sharply in the international market from the beginning of the year. 
					 The corn price was $243 per ton on February 5, 87.68 percent higher than the same period of last year, while the wheat price jumped 83.16 percent and bean 58.09 percent.
					
					 The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) said on Feb. 3 that the food price is a record high in the world since 1990.
					
					 A reason of the grain price rise is abnormal weather. 
					
					 The world's major granaries have been affected by drought, torrential rain, severe cold and sultriness.
					
					 Hebei, Shandong and other areas of China are suffering from the worst drought in 300 years.
					
					 Vast plains in the middle and western part of the Untied States, main corn and wheat producers, have long been damaged by drought, while the eastern area of Australia was struck by flood so that the wheat output is likely to be decreased 50 percent.
					
					 Argentina and Brazil, the world's largest bean exporters, have also been hit by severe drought.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Italy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Italy
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" was brought out in booklet by the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy on Feb. 10.
					 The work, published on November 1, 1994, clarifies the idea that Korean-style socialism based on the socialist theory of Juche is the most scientific and vital one. It also gives clear exposition of the principled matters arising in defending socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Studied Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Studied Abroad
						
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Seminars on works of General Secretary Kim Jong Il were held on Feb. 5 by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 The chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy said that Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centered on the Masses Shall Not Perish" serves as the powerful ideological weapon refuting sophism of the imperialists and dynamically propelling socialist construction.
					
					 Explaining the invincibility and solidity of unique Korean socialism centered on the popular masses, the speaker said: Since the publication of the work, the DPRK has victoriously beat back the foreign forces' every move to stifle socialism, regarding the work as its guideline.
					
					 The chairman of the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea noted that Kim Jong Il in his work "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" explained in a scientific way why those countries building socialism and their ruling parties had collapsed all at once.
					
					 The Pyongyang Declaration, adopted in April 1992, was signed by political parties in different countries, and the progressive people of the world have expressed their sympathy with it, he said, adding: This goes to prove that the socialist idea reflects the aspiration and desire of the progressive mankind.
					
					  We will intensify the study and dissemination of Kim Jong Il's works and the Juche idea, he declared.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Meng Jianzhu
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Meng Jianzhu
						
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 14 en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Meng Jianzhu, consejero de Estado y ministro de Seguridad  Publica de la Republica Popular China, y su comitiva.
					En la ocasion el visitante chino senalo que son fraternales y camaraderiles las relaciones de amistad China-Corea establecidas con sangre.
					
					Subrayo que la amistad China-Corea forjada por los lideres de generacion veterana de ambos paises debe seguir fortaleciendose y desarrollandose de generacion en generacion.
					
					Visitando varios lugares, conoci bien que el pueblo coreano alcanza exitos magnificos en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista usando el espiritu y modo revolucionarios de lucha, destaco.
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que bajo la sabia direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano lograra en el futuro mayores exitos.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Ju Sang Song y Meng Jianzhu
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Ju Sang Song y Meng Jianzhu
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 13 en esta capital las conversaciones entre Ju Sang Song, miembro del Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, y Meng Jianzhu, consejero de Estado de la Republica Popular China y ministro de Seguridad Publica.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el viceministro Choe Jung Hwa y otros funcionarios del MINSEP, y por la china, la comitiva del consejero de Estado y el embajador chino en Corea, Liu Hongcai.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron criterios sobre el problema de desarrollar el intercambio y la cooperacion entre los organos de seguridad de los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Rubricado convenio entre ministerios de seguridad de Corea y China
articles.content:
Rubricado convenio entre ministerios de seguridad de Corea y China
						
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ATCC) -- Quedo firmado el dia 13 en esta capital el convenio sobre la cooperacion entre el Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el Ministerio de Seguridad  Publica de la Republica Popular China.
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el ministro Ju Sang Song, miembro del CDN de la RPDC, y otros funcionarios del MINSEP, y por la china, el ministro Meng Jianzhu, consejero de Estado de la RPCh, y su comitiva y Liu Hongcai, embajador chino acreditado en Corea.
					
					Suscribieron el documento Ju y Meng.

articles.title: MINSEP ofrece banquete en honor de de Meng Jianzhu y su comitiva
articles.content:
MINSEP ofrece banquete en honor de de Meng Jianzhu y su comitiva
						
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 13 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae un banquete en honor del ministro de Seguridad Publica de la Republica Popular China y su comitiva.
					Fueron invitados a la recepcion el ministro Meng Jianzhu, consejero de Estado de la RPCh, y su comitiva, Liu Hongcai, embajador chino en Corea y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica.
					
					Estuvieron presentes alli Ju Sang Song, miembro del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, el viceministro Choe Jung Hwa y otros funcionarios del MINSEP.
					
					En su discurso pronunciado en el banquete, Ju destaco que la presente visita de Meng significa primer paso a la amistad Corea-China de este ano, y da gran alegria al ejercito y el pueblo coreanos que acogen el cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Se refirio a que el ano pasado el Dirigente visito en dos ocasiones a China y se reunio con el colectivo de direccion central de China incluido el secretario general Hu Jintao.
					
					Desarrollar de generacion en generacion la tradicional amistad Corea-China es la invariable posicion de nuestro partido y gobierno, dijo y destaco que tambien en el ano en curso en que se cumplira el 50o aniversario de la concertacion del tratado sobre la amistad, la cooperacion y la ayuda mutua entre Corea y China, la RPDC hara ingentes esfuerzos por consolidar y desarrollar la amistad Corea-China conforme a la voluntad de los maximos dirigentes de los dos paises.
					
					A su vez, Meng senalo que la amistad China-Corea es valioso tesoro preparado por los dirigentes de veterana generacion de ambos paises y preciso que hoy las relaciones de esta amistad continuan fortaleciendose y desarrollandose en medio de  profunda atencion de los Secretarios Generales Hu Jintao y Kim Jong Il.
					
					Destaco que en el ano pasado, el Secretario General Kim Jong Il visito en dos veces a China y puso en una nueva etapa las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					Prosiguio que consolidarlas y desarrollarlas es la firme orientacion del PCCh y el pueblo chino.
					
					Por ultimo, manifesto su conviccion de que bajo la direccion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea encabezado por el Secretario General Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano registrara nuevo y gran auge revolucionario y lograra mayores exitos en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista.

articles.title: MINSEP de China dona materiales de ayuda a su homologo de Corea
articles.content:
MINSEP de China dona materiales de ayuda a su homologo de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Ministerio de Seguridad Publica de la Republica Popular China dono los materiales de ayuda al Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Tuvo lugar el dia 13 en esta capital el acto de donacion.
					
					Participaron alli por la parte coreana el ministro Ju Sang Song, miembro del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC, y otros funcionarios del MINSEP, y por la china, el ministro Meng Jianzhu, consejero de Estado de la RPCh, y su comitiva, y Liu Hongcai, embajador chino en Corea.

articles.title: Inaugurado XV festival de Kimjongilias
articles.content:
Inaugurado XV festival de Kimjongilias
  Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ATCC) -- Quedo iniciado el dia 14 en esta capital el 15? Festival de Kimjongilias dedicado al dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					  En la sede del festival estaban exhibidas esas flores cultivadas con esmero por los organismos de las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, ministerios, organos centrales y otras unidades, militares del ejercito popular, trabajadores de distintos estratos, jovenes y ninos escolares. 
					
					   Entre los exponentes figuran tambien el Presidium del Comite Central de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), compatriotas en ultramar, las representaciones diplomaticas de varios paises y las de organizaciones internacionales, acreditadas en Corea, las entidades extranjeras de amistad y solidaridad, y chinos residentes en Corea. 
					
					  En la ceremonia inaugural estuvieron presentes Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, Kang Nung Su y otros funcionarios y lo grupos de felicitacion de coreanos residentes en Japon y otros paises. 
					
					  El ministro de Cultura An Tong Chun pronuncio el discurso de apertura. 
					
					  Terminado el acto, los participantes recorrieron el lugar de exposicion.
